benchmark_details.name: PL-Guard
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce PL-Guard, a manually verified Polish-language benchmark for safety classification, along with PL-Guard-adv, its adversarial extension featuring text perturbations to evaluate model robustness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust evaluation of language model safety specifically for Polish, addressing the gap in non-English safety evaluation.

data.source: Manually annotated Polish-language data and translated datasets from WildGuard and PolyGuard.
data.size: 7,000 samples for PL-Guard; 900 samples for PL-Guard-test.
data.annotation: Manual review and re-annotation by trained annotators with high inter-annotator agreement.

methodology.calculation: Calculated as macro F1 scores for binary safety and multiclass hazard categories.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in detecting unsafe outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: HerBERT-based classifier achieves high performance on safety classification tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using both original and adversarial test datasets to assess robustness.
